input:
User stories for Real estate listings website
289. As a user, I want to be able to search for properties in a specific location so that I can find homes that fit my needs and preferences.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should have a search bar accessible from the homepage.
	The user should be able to input a specific location or select a location from a drop-down menu.
	The website should display a list of available properties in the selected location.
	The user should be able to filter the search results by price, number of bedrooms/bathrooms, square footage, and other relevant criteria.
	The website should display high-quality photos and detailed descriptions of each property.

290. As a user, I want to be able to save my favorite properties so that I can easily access them later and compare them to other listings.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should allow the user to create an account and sign in.
	The user should be able to save properties to their account by clicking a "save" button on each listing.
	The website should display a list of the user's saved properties on their account dashboard.
	The user should be able to compare the details of their saved properties side-by-side.
	The website should send email alerts to the user when new properties that meet their criteria are listed.

291. As a user, I want to be able to contact real estate agents directly through the website so that I can get more information about a property or schedule a viewing.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should display contact information for the listing agent on each property page.
	The user should be able to send a message to the agent directly through the website or via email.
	The website should confirm that the message was sent and display a message history between the user and the agent.
	The user should be able to schedule a viewing of the property directly with the agent through the website.
	The website should provide the user with the option to rate and provide feedback on their experience with the agent.

292. As a user, I want to be able to view properties on a map so that I can easily see their location and proximity to important landmarks.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should have a map view accessible from the homepage.
	The user should be able to search for properties in a specific location and see them displayed on the map.
	The website should provide a zoom function for the map so that the user can see more detail.
	The user should be able to filter the properties displayed on the map by price, number of bedrooms/bathrooms, and other relevant criteria.
	The website should provide a list of the properties displayed on the map, including photos and detailed descriptions.

293. As a user, I want to be able to view properties in a virtual tour so that I can get a better sense of their layout and features before visiting in person.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should have a virtual tour feature accessible from each property page.
	The virtual tour should allow the user to navigate through the property using high-quality photos or videos.
	The virtual tour should display information about each room and feature of the property as the user navigates through it.
	The user should be able to pause or rewind the virtual tour to focus on specific rooms or features.
	The website should provide the option for the user to contact the listing agent or schedule a viewing of the property directly from the virtual tour page.

294. As a user, I want to be able to view historical property data so that I can understand the property's value and potential future trends.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide historical sales data for each property, including previous sales prices and dates.
	The website should provide data on the property's market value and appreciation over time.
	The user should be able to view trends in the local real estate market, such as median home prices and inventory levels.
	The website should display data in an easy-to-understand format, such as charts or graphs.
	The user should be able to save historical property data to their account for future reference.

295. As a user, I want to be able to receive alerts when a property that meets my criteria becomes available so that I can stay up-to-date on the market.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should allow the user to create an account and sign in.
	The user should be able to set up alerts for specific criteria, such as location, price range, and number of bedrooms/bathrooms.
	The website should send email alerts to the user when a property that meets their criteria is listed.
	The user should be able to manage their alerts and update their criteria at any time.
	The website should provide the option for the user to receive alerts via SMS or push notification.

296. As a user, I want to be able to view property details and amenities so that I can make an informed decision about whether to schedule a viewing.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide detailed information about each property, including the number of bedrooms/bathrooms, square footage, and other relevant details.
	The website should display high-quality photos of the property's interior and exterior.
	The user should be able to view a list of amenities, such as a pool, gym, or parking garage, that are included with the property.
	The website should provide information on the property's location and proximity to important landmarks, such as schools and parks.
	The user should be able to request more information or schedule a viewing of the property directly from the property page.

297. As a user, I want to be able to save search criteria so that I can easily find new listings that meet my preferences.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should allow the user to create an account and sign in.
	The user should be able to save search criteria, such as location, price range, and number of bedrooms/bathrooms.
	The website should display a list of the user's saved search criteria on their account dashboard.
	The user should be able to quickly access their saved search criteria and see new listings that meet their preferences.
	The website should provide the option for the user to receive email or push notification alerts when new listings that meet their criteria are listed.

298. As a user, I want to be able to leave reviews of properties I have viewed so that I can share my experience with other potential buyers.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should allow the user to create an account and sign in.
	The user should be able to leave a review of the property, including a star rating and written feedback.
	The review should be displayed on the property page for other users to see.
	The user should be able to edit or delete their review at any time.
	The website should have a moderation system in place to ensure that reviews are appropriate and do not contain any offensive or misleading content.

299. As a user, I want to be able to compare multiple properties side-by-side so that I can easily compare their features and make an informed decision.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should allow the user to select multiple properties from their search results.
	The selected properties should be displayed in a side-by-side comparison table.
	The comparison table should display key features of each property, such as number of bedrooms/bathrooms, square footage, and price.
	The user should be able to easily switch between properties in the comparison table.
	The website should allow the user to save their comparison table for future reference.

300. As a user, I want to be able to view 3D virtual tours of properties so that I can get a more immersive experience of the property.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide 3D virtual tours for each property, created using technology such as Matterport or iGUIDE.
	The virtual tour should provide a realistic, immersive experience of the property's interior and exterior.
	The user should be able to control the virtual tour using their mouse or keyboard.
	The website should display relevant information about the property during the virtual tour, such as the number of bedrooms/bathrooms and square footage.
	The user should be able to schedule a viewing of the property directly from the virtual tour page.

301. As a user, I want to be able to filter search results by specific criteria so that I can quickly find properties that meet my preferences.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should display a search form that allows the user to enter their search criteria, such as location, price range, and number of bedrooms/bathrooms.
	The website should allow the user to apply additional filters to their search, such as property type (e.g. house, condo, apartment) or amenities (e.g. pool, gym, parking garage).
	The website should display search results that match the user's search criteria and filters.
	The user should be able to sort their search results by relevant criteria, such as price or square footage.
	The website should allow the user to save their search criteria and filters for future reference.

302. As a user, I want to be able to view properties on a map so that I can see their location and proximity to other landmarks.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should display a map that shows the location of each property in the search results.
	The user should be able to zoom in and out of the map to view properties at different levels of detail.
	The map should display relevant information about each property, such as the number of bedrooms/bathrooms and price.
	The user should be able to filter their search results on the map based on specific criteria, such as price range or property type.
	The website should allow the user to view more detailed information about a property by clicking on its location marker on the map.
 Create a use case diagram based on the above.
output:
@startuml
left to right direction

actor User

rectangle RealEstateListingsWebsite {
    usecase "Search Properties" as UC1
    usecase "Filter search results" as UC1A
    usecase "Save search criteria" as UC1B

    usecase "View Properties" as UC2
    usecase "View properties on a map" as UC2A
    usecase "View properties in a 3D virtual tour" as UC2B

    usecase "Save favorite properties" as UC3
    usecase "Contact real estate agents" as UC4
    usecase "View historical property data" as UC5
    usecase "View property details and amenities" as UC6
    usecase "Leave property reviews" as UC7
    usecase "Compare properties" as UC8

    usecase "Receive property alerts" as UC9
}

UC1 ..> UC1B : <<extend>>

UC2 ..> UC2A: <<extend>>
UC2 ..> UC2B: <<extend>>

User --> UC1
User --> UC2

User --> UC4

User --> UC9
@enduml

input:
User stories for Masters thesis management system
351. As a student, I want to be able to submit my thesis proposal to the system so that I can receive feedback and approval from my advisor.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The system should provide a submission form for students to upload their thesis proposal.
	The student should be able to enter their thesis title, abstract, and research objectives.
	The system should notify the student's advisor of the submission and request feedback within a specified timeframe.
	The advisor should be able to review the proposal, provide comments, and approve or reject the submission.
	The system should send an email notification to the student with the advisor's feedback and decision.

352. As an advisor, I want to be able to review and approve students' thesis proposals so that I can guide their research and ensure academic quality.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The system should provide an advisor dashboard where the advisor can view pending thesis proposals.
	The advisor should be able to access the student's proposal, read the abstract, and review the research objectives.
	The system should provide a comment feature for the advisor to leave feedback and suggestions for improvement.
	The advisor should be able to approve or reject the proposal and provide a rationale for their decision.
	The system should send an email notification to the student with the advisor's feedback and decision.

353. As a student, I want to be able to submit my thesis draft to the system so that I can receive feedback and make revisions before the final submission.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The system should provide a submission form for students to upload their thesis draft.
	The student should be able to enter their thesis title, abstract, and research findings.
	The system should notify the student's advisor of the submission and request feedback within a specified timeframe.
	The advisor should be able to review the draft, provide comments, and suggest revisions for improvement.
	The system should send an email notification to the student with the advisor's feedback and suggestions.

354. As an advisor, I want to be able to review and provide feedback on students' thesis drafts so that I can support their research and academic development.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The system should provide an advisor dashboard where the advisor can view pending thesis drafts.
	The advisor should be able to access the student's draft and read the research findings.
	The system should provide a comment feature for the advisor to leave feedback on the content, structure, and formatting.
	The advisor should be able to suggest revisions and improvements to the draft to enhance its quality.
	The system should send an email notification to the student with the advisor's feedback and suggestions.

355. As a student, I want to be able to submit my final thesis to the system for evaluation and grading so that I can complete my degree requirements.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The system should provide a submission form for students to upload their final thesis document.
	The student should be able to enter their thesis title, abstract, research methodology, and conclusions.
	The system should notify the student's advisor and committee members of the submission for evaluation.
	The advisor and committee members should be able to review the thesis, provide feedback, and assign a grade based on academic standards.
	The system should send an email notification to the student with the evaluation results and final grade.

356. As an advisor, I want to be able to evaluate and grade students' final theses so that I can assess their research skills and academic achievement.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The system should provide an advisor dashboard where the advisor can view pending thesis submissions.
	The advisor should be able to access the student's final thesis document and review the research methodology and conclusions.
	The system should provide a grading rubric for evaluating the thesis based on content, originality, organization, and writing quality.
	The advisor should be able to assign a grade and provide detailed feedback on the strengths and weaknesses of the thesis.
	The system should send an email notification to the student with the evaluation results and final grade.

357. As a student, I want to be able to track the progress of my thesis submission and evaluation so that I can stay informed and meet deadlines.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The system should provide a student dashboard where the student can view the status of their thesis submissions.
	The student should be able to see the dates of submission, advisor feedback, and evaluation results.
	The system should display reminders and notifications for upcoming deadlines and milestones in the thesis process.
	The student should be able to contact their advisor or committee members through the system for questions or updates.
	The system should provide a progress bar or timeline to track the completion of thesis requirements.

358. As an administrator, I want to be able to manage user accounts, access reports, and monitor system performance so that I can ensure the reliability and effectiveness of the thesis management system.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The system should provide an administrator dashboard where the administrator can view user accounts and reports.
	The administrator should be able to create, edit, and delete user accounts for students, advisors, committee members, and other staff.
	The system should provide usage reports on the number of thesis submissions, evaluations, and grades assigned.
	The administrator should be able to view detailed reports on thesis evaluation results, including trends over time and common areas for improvement.
	The system should display system performance metrics, such as response time, uptime, and error rates.

359. As a student, I want to be able to access resources and guidelines on thesis writing and research methodology so that I can improve my academic writing skills and complete my thesis successfully.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The system should provide a resources section with articles, videos, and tutorials on thesis writing and research methodology.
	The student should be able to access guides on how to structure a thesis, write a literature review, and present research findings.
	The system should provide examples of successful theses and common mistakes to avoid.
	The student should be able to take quizzes and self-assessments on thesis writing and research methodology.
	The system should provide links to additional resources and tools for improving academic writing skills and research techniques.
 Create a use case diagram for this.
output:
@startuml
left to right direction

actor Student
actor Advisor
actor Administrator

rectangle MastersThesisManagementSystem {
    usecase "Submit Thesis Proposal" as UC1A
    usecase "Submit Thesis Draft" as UC1B
    usecase "Submit Final Thesis" as UC1C
    usecase "Submit Thesis" as UC1

    usecase "Track Thesis Submission Progress" as UC2A
    usecase "Track Thesis Evaluation Progress" as UC2B
    usecase "Track Progress" as UC2
    
    usecase "Review Thesis Proposals" as UC3A
    usecase "Approve Thesis Proposals" as UC3B
    usecase "Manage Thesis Proposals" as UC3
    
    usecase "Review Thesis Drafts" as UC4A
    usecase "Provide Feedback on Thesis Drafts" as UC4B
    usecase "Manage Thesis Drafts" as UC4
    
    usecase "Evaluate Final Theses" as UC5A
    usecase "Grade Final Theses" as UC5B
    usecase "Manage Final Theses" as UC5
    
    usecase "Manage User Accounts" as UC6A
    usecase "Access Reports" as UC6B
    usecase "Manage Accounts and Reports" as UC6
    
    usecase "Access Thesis Writing Guidelines" as UC7A
    usecase "Access Thesis Writing Resources" as UC7
}

input:
User stories for E-commerce website
303. As a user, I want to be able to search for products by category so that I can easily find items that I am interested in.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should have a search bar accessible from the homepage.
	The user should be able to browse products by category, such as electronics, clothing, or home goods.
	The website should display a list of products in the selected category.
	The user should be able to filter the search results by price, brand, size, color, and other relevant criteria.
	The website should display high-quality photos and detailed descriptions of each product.

304. As a user, I want to be able to view product details and reviews so that I can make an informed decision about whether to purchase.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide detailed information about each product, including price, size, color, and other relevant details.
	The website should display high-quality photos of the product from multiple angles.
	The user should be able to read reviews of the product from other customers.
	The website should display an average star rating for the product based on customer reviews.
	The user should be able to ask questions about the product and receive answers from the seller or other customers.

305. As a user, I want to be able to add products to my shopping cart so that I can easily keep track of items I want to purchase.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should have a shopping cart icon accessible from every page.
	The user should be able to add products to their shopping cart by clicking an "add to cart" button on the product page.
	The website should display a summary of the user's shopping cart, including the total number of items and the total cost.
	The user should be able to view and edit the items in their shopping cart before proceeding to checkout.
	The website should save the user's shopping cart items for future visits.

306. As a user, I want to be able to view my order history and track the status of my shipments so that I can stay informed about my purchases.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide an account dashboard where the user can view their order history.
	The user should be able to see the status of each order, including whether it has been processed, shipped, or delivered.
	The website should display tracking information for each shipment, including the estimated delivery date.
	The user should be able to contact customer support if they have questions or concerns about their order.
	The website should send email notifications to the user when their order status changes.

307. As a user, I want to be able to save my payment information so that I can quickly and securely make purchases.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide a secure payment portal for entering credit card information.
	The user should be able to save their payment information to their account for future purchases.
	The website should display a confirmation message when the user's payment information is saved successfully.
	The user should be able to edit or delete their payment information at any time.
	The website should comply with industry standards for payment security, such as PCI DSS compliance.

308. As a user, I want to be able to receive personalized product recommendations based on my browsing and purchase history so that I can discover new items that I may be interested in.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide product recommendations on the homepage and product pages.
	The recommendations should be based on the user's browsing and purchase history.
	The user should be able to view and dismiss product recommendations if they are not interested.
	The website should provide an option for the user to provide feedback on the recommendations.
	The user should be able to opt out of personalized recommendations if they prefer.

309. As a user, I want to be able to view products on sale or with discounts so that I can find deals and save money on my purchases.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should have a section for products on sale or with discounts accessible from the homepage.
	The user should be able to browse products by discount percentage or price range.
	The website should display the original price and discounted price for each product.
	The user should be able to filter the sale products by category, brand, or other relevant criteria.
	The website should provide a countdown timer for limited-time sales or discounts.

310. As a user, I want to be able to contact customer support through the website so that I can get help with my purchases or resolve any issues.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide a contact form or live chat feature accessible from every page.
	The user should be able to submit a message to customer support with their questions or concerns.
	The website should display a confirmation message when the user's message is sent successfully.
	The user should receive a response from customer support within a reasonable timeframe.
	The website should provide a phone number or email address for users who prefer to contact customer support by phone or email.

311. As a user, I want to be able to view product availability and delivery options so that I can make an informed decision about my purchase.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should display the availability of each product, including whether it is in stock or on backorder.
	The user should be able to select a delivery option, such as standard shipping, express shipping, or in-store pickup.
	The website should display the estimated delivery date for each delivery option.
	The user should be able to track the status of their shipment once it has been processed.
	The website should provide information on shipping costs and any applicable taxes or fees.

312. As a user, I want to be able to view product ratings and reviews so that I can make an informed decision about my purchase.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should display an average star rating for each product based on customer reviews.
	The user should be able to read written reviews of the product from other customers.
	The website should display the number of reviews and the overall rating for each product.
	The user should be able to filter reviews by star rating or keyword.
	The website should provide an option for the user to leave a review of the product after making a purchase.

313. As a user, I want to be able to view product recommendations based on trending or popular items so that I can discover new products that are currently popular.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should have a section for trending or popular products accessible from the homepage.
	The user should be able to browse products by category or price range.
	The website should display the number of views or purchases for each product to indicate its popularity.
	The user should be able to filter the trending products by category, brand, or other relevant criteria.
	The website should provide an option for the user to provide feedback on the trending products.

314. As a user, I want to be able to view product recommendations based on my wishlist or saved items so that I can discover new products that are similar to ones I am interested in.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide product recommendations based on the user's wishlist or saved items.
	The user should be able to view and dismiss product recommendations on the homepage and product pages.
	The recommendations should be based on the user's browsing and purchase history.
	The user should be able to provide feedback on the recommendations and indicate whether they are interested in the products.
	The website should provide an option for the user to opt out of personalized recommendations if they prefer.
 Make a use case diagram for the above user stories.
output:

left to right direction

actor User

    usecase "Search and View Products" as UC1
    usecase "Add Products to Shopping Cart" as UC2
    usecase "Manage Orders" as UC3
    usecase "Manage Payment Information" as UC4
    usecase "Receive Product Recommendations" as UC5
    usecase "Contact Customer Support" as UC6

    usecase "View Product Details" as UC1A
    usecase "View Product Availability" as UC1B
    usecase "View Product Reviews" as UC1C
    usecase "View Products on Sale" as UC1D

    usecase "View Order History" as UC3A
    usecase "Track Shipments" as UC3B
    
    usecase "Recommendations based on Trends" as UC5A

}

input:
User stories for Online learning platform
315. As a user, I want to be able to search for courses by topic or keyword so that I can find courses that match my interests and goals.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should have a search bar accessible from the homepage.
	The user should be able to search for courses by entering a topic or keyword.
	The website should display a list of courses that match the user's search criteria.
	The user should be able to filter the search results by price, duration, level, and other relevant criteria.
	The website should display detailed descriptions and course previews for each course.

316. As a user, I want to be able to enroll in courses and track my progress so that I can learn at my own pace and stay motivated.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide a user account dashboard where the user can view their enrolled courses.
	The user should be able to enroll in a course by clicking an "enroll" button on the course page.
	The website should display the user's progress in each course, including completed lessons and quizzes.
	The user should be able to mark lessons as complete and track their overall course progress.
	The website should provide reminders and notifications to keep the user engaged and motivated.

317. As a user, I want to be able to access course materials and resources so that I can learn effectively and apply what I have learned.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide downloadable course materials, such as lecture slides, readings, and assignments.
	The user should be able to access course resources, such as video lectures, quizzes, and discussion forums.
	The website should provide interactive learning tools, such as virtual labs or simulations.
	The user should be able to download or print course materials for offline use.
	The website should provide links to additional resources and recommended readings for each course.

318. As a user, I want to be able to communicate with instructors and other students so that I can ask questions, share ideas, and collaborate on projects.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide a discussion forum or chat feature for each course.
	The user should be able to post questions and comments to the forum and receive responses from instructors and other students.
	The website should display a list of instructors and their contact information for each course.
	The user should be able to send messages to instructors and receive feedback on assignments and projects.
	The website should provide a feature for students to collaborate on group projects and assignments.

319. As a user, I want to be able to receive feedback and grades on my assignments and quizzes so that I can track my learning progress and improve my skills.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide a grading rubric for each assignment or quiz that outlines the criteria for evaluation.
	The user should be able to submit assignments and quizzes through the website's learning management system.
	The website should display feedback and grades for each assignment or quiz within a reasonable timeframe.
	The user should be able to view detailed feedback from instructors and suggestions for improvement.
	The website should provide a feature for the user to resubmit assignments or retake quizzes if needed.

320. As a user, I want to be able to access course certificates and badges so that I can showcase my achievements and skills to potential employers.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide digital certificates and badges for completing courses and passing assessments.
	The user should be able to download and share their certificates and badges on social media or professional networking sites.
	The website should display a list of the user's earned certificates and badges on their account dashboard.
	The user should be able to view the requirements for earning each certificate or badge.
	The website should provide a verification system for employers to confirm the authenticity of certificates and badges.

321. As a user, I want to be able to access course recommendations and personalized learning paths so that I can discover new topics and skills to learn.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide course recommendations on the homepage and user account dashboard.
	The recommendations should be based on the user's browsing and enrollment history.
	The user should be able to view and dismiss course recommendations if they are not interested.
	The website should provide personalized learning paths that outline a sequence of courses to achieve specific learning goals.
	The user should be able to track their progress along their personalized learning path.

322. As a user, I want to be able to access course reviews and ratings so that I can make an informed decision about which courses to enroll in.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should display an average star rating for each course based on user reviews.
	The user should be able to read written reviews of the course from other students.
	The website should display the number of reviews and the overall rating for each course.
	The user should be able to filter reviews by star rating or keyword.
	The website should provide an option for the user to leave a review of the course after completing it.

323. As a user, I want to be able to access course previews and free trials so that I can evaluate the course content and teaching style before enrolling.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide a preview or sample of each course, such as a video lecture or lesson summary.
	The user should be able to access a free trial of the course for a limited time or with limited access to course materials.
	The website should display information about the course instructor, including their qualifications and teaching experience.
	The user should be able to view the course syllabus and learning objectives before enrolling.
	The website should provide a feature for the user to request more information about the course or instructor before enrolling.
 Make me a use case diagram based on the user stories above.
output:
@startuml
left to right direction

actor User

rectangle OnlineLearningPlatform {
    usecase "Search Courses" as UC1
    usecase "Enroll in Course" as UC2
    usecase "Access Learning Materials" as UC3
    usecase "Collaborate" as UC4
    usecase "Access Course Recommendations" as UC6

    usecase "Access Course Reviews and Ratings" as UC1A
    usecase "Access Course Previews and Free Trials" as UC1B

    usecase "Track Course Progress" as UC2A
    usecase "Access Course Certificates and Badges" as UC5A
    usecase "Receive Feedback and Grades" as UC5B
}

UC1 ..> UC1A : <<extend>>
UC1 ..> UC1B : <<extend>>

User --> UC2A

User --> UC5A
User --> UC5B 

User --> UC1
User --> UC2
User --> UC3
User --> UC4
User --> UC6
@enduml

input:
User stories for Hotel booking system
324. As a user, I want to be able to search for hotels by location and date so that I can find accommodations for my trip.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should have a search bar accessible from the homepage.
	The user should be able to enter a location, check-in date, and check-out date to search for hotels.
	The website should display a list of available hotels in the selected location.
	The user should be able to filter the search results by price, star rating, amenities, and other relevant criteria.
	The website should display high-quality photos and detailed descriptions of each hotel.

325. As a user, I want to be able to view hotel details and room options so that I can make an informed decision about where to stay.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide detailed information about each hotel, including room types, amenities, and policies.
	The user should be able to view photos of each room type and common areas of the hotel.
	The website should display the price per night for each room type and any additional fees or taxes.
	The user should be able to read reviews of the hotel from other guests.
	The website should provide information on the hotel's location and proximity to local attractions.

326. As a user, I want to be able to book a hotel room online so that I can secure my accommodations for my trip.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should have a booking form accessible from each hotel page.
	The user should be able to select a room type, check-in date, and check-out date to book a room.
	The website should display the total cost of the booking, including any taxes or fees.
	The user should be able to enter their payment information and confirm the booking.
	The website should send a confirmation email to the user with their booking details.

327. As a user, I want to be able to view my booking history and manage my reservations so that I can keep track of my upcoming trips.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide an account dashboard where the user can view their booking history.
	The user should be able to see a list of their past and upcoming reservations.
	The website should display the booking details for each reservation, including check-in and check-out dates, room type, and total cost.
	The user should be able to cancel or modify their reservations within a specified timeframe.
	The website should send email reminders to the user before their check-in date.

328. As a user, I want to be able to contact the hotel directly through the website so that I can ask questions or request special accommodations.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should display contact information for each hotel, including phone number and email address.
	The user should be able to send a message to the hotel directly through the website or via email.
	The website should confirm that the message was sent and display a message history between the user and the hotel.
	The user should be able to request special accommodations, such as a late check-in or room preferences.
	The website should provide the user with the option to rate and provide feedback on their experience with the hotel.

329. As a user, I want to be able to view hotel amenities and policies so that I can choose accommodations that meet my needs and preferences.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide a list of amenities offered by each hotel, such as free breakfast, Wi-Fi, or parking.
	The user should be able to view the hotel's policies, such as cancellation fees, pet policies, and check-in/check-out times.
	The website should display information on the hotel's facilities, such as a pool, gym, or restaurant.
	The user should be able to request additional services, such as airport shuttle or room service.
	The website should provide information on the hotel's accessibility features, such as wheelchair ramps or elevators.

330. As a user, I want to be able to view hotel reviews and ratings so that I can make an informed decision about where to stay.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should display an average star rating for each hotel based on guest reviews.
	The user should be able to read written reviews of the hotel from other guests.
	The website should display the number of reviews and the overall rating for each hotel.
	The user should be able to filter reviews by star rating or keyword.
	The website should provide an option for the user to leave a review of the hotel after their stay.

331. As a user, I want to be able to receive alerts when a hotel that meets my criteria becomes available so that I can stay up-to-date on availability and pricing.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should allow the user to create an account and sign in.
	The user should be able to set up alerts for specific criteria, such as location, price range, and amenities.
	The website should send email alerts to the user when a hotel that meets their criteria is available.
	The user should be able to manage their alerts and update their criteria at any time.
	The website should provide the option for the user to receive alerts via SMS or push notification.

332. As a user, I want to be able to view hotel photos and virtual tours so that I can get a better sense of the property before booking.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should display high-quality photos of each hotel, including rooms, common areas, and amenities.
	The user should be able to view a virtual tour of the hotel using technology such as Matterport or iGUIDE.
	The virtual tour should allow the user to navigate through the hotel and view different areas.
	The user should be able to pause or rewind the virtual tour to focus on specific rooms or features.
	The website should provide the option for the user to contact the hotel directly from the virtual tour page.

333. As a user, I want to be able to view hotel location and nearby attractions so that I can choose accommodations that are convenient and close to points of interest.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should display a map that shows the location of each hotel in the search results.
	The user should be able to search for hotels in a specific location and see them displayed on the map.
	The map should provide information on nearby attractions, such as restaurants, shops, and tourist sites.
	The user should be able to filter the hotels displayed on the map by price, star rating, and other relevant criteria.
	The website should provide a list of the hotels displayed on the map, including photos and detailed descriptions.
 Make a use case diagram for it.
output:

left to right direction

input:
User stories for Babysitter hiring app
334. As a parent, I want to be able to search for babysitters in my area so that I can find a reliable caregiver for my child.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The app should have a search bar accessible from the homepage.
	The parent should be able to enter their location and search for available babysitters.
	The app should display a list of babysitters in the selected area, including their profiles and availability.
	The parent should be able to filter the search results by price, experience, and other relevant criteria.
	The app should display reviews and ratings for each babysitter from other parents.

335. As a parent, I want to be able to view babysitter profiles and qualifications so that I can make an informed decision about who to hire.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The app should provide detailed profiles for each babysitter, including their experience, qualifications, and availability.
	The parent should be able to view photos of the babysitter, as well as any certifications or background checks.
	The app should display reviews and ratings for the babysitter from other parents.
	The parent should be able to contact the babysitter directly through the app to ask questions or schedule an interview.
	The app should provide information on the babysitter's hourly rate and any additional fees.

336. As a parent, I want to be able to book a babysitter online so that I can easily schedule care for my child.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The app should have a booking form accessible from each babysitter's profile.
	The parent should be able to select a date, time, and duration for the babysitting appointment.
	The app should display the total cost of the booking, including any additional fees or taxes.
	The parent should be able to enter their payment information and confirm the booking.
	The app should send a confirmation email to the parent and the babysitter with the booking details.

337. As a parent, I want to be able to view my booking history and manage my appointments so that I can keep track of my child's care schedule.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The app should provide an account dashboard where the parent can view their booking history.
	The parent should be able to see a list of their past and upcoming babysitting appointments.
   The app should display the booking details for each appointment, including the babysitter's name, date, time, and total cost.
	The parent should be able to cancel or reschedule appointments within a specified timeframe.
	The app should send reminders to the parent and the babysitter before each appointment.

338. As a parent, I want to be able to contact the babysitter directly through the app so that I can communicate about my child's needs and preferences.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The app should provide a messaging feature for parents and babysitters to communicate.
	The parent should be able to send messages to the babysitter with instructions, questions, or updates.
	The app should display a message history between the parent and the babysitter for each appointment.
	The parent should be able to request special accommodations or provide information about their child's routine.
	The app should provide the parent with the option to rate and provide feedback on the babysitter after each appointment.

339. As a parent, I want to be able to view babysitter availability and schedule appointments in advance so that I can plan my child's care in advance.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The app should display each babysitter's availability on their profile, including days and times they are available.
	The parent should be able to schedule appointments with the babysitter in advance based on their availability.
	The app should provide a calendar feature for parents to view their upcoming appointments and availability.
	The parent should be able to request recurring appointments or set up a regular care schedule.
	The app should send reminders to the parent and the babysitter before each appointment.

340. As a parent, I want to be able to view babysitter reviews and ratings so that I can make an informed decision about who to hire.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The app should display an average star rating for each babysitter based on parent reviews.
	The parent should be able to read written reviews of the babysitter from other parents.
	The app should display the number of reviews and the overall rating for each babysitter.
	The parent should be able to filter reviews by star rating or keyword.
	The app should provide an option for the parent to leave a review of the babysitter after each appointment.

341. As a babysitter, I want to be able to create a profile and list my qualifications and availability so that I can connect with parents looking for childcare.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The app should provide a registration form for babysitters to create a profile.
	The babysitter should be able to enter their qualifications, experience, and availability.
	The app should allow the babysitter to upload photos, certifications, and background checks to their profile.
	The babysitter should be able to set their hourly rate and any additional fees for their services.
	The app should display the babysitter's profile to parents searching for childcare in the area.

342. As a babysitter, I want to be able to receive booking requests and communicate with parents through the app so that I can easily manage my appointments.
Acceptance Criteria:

	The app should display a list of upcoming appointments for the babysitter, including the parent's name, date, time, and location.
	The babysitter should be able to send messages to parents with questions, instructions, or updates.
	The app should provide the babysitter with the option to rate and provide feedback on the parent after each appointment.

343. As a babysitter, I want to be able to view my booking history and manage my appointments so that I can keep track of my schedule and earnings.
Acceptance Criteria:

	The babysitter should be able to see a list of their past and upcoming appointments.
	The app should display the booking details for each appointment, including the parent's name, date, time, and total cost.
	The babysitter should be able to cancel or reschedule appointments within a specified timeframe.

input:
User stories for Turnitin plagiarism checker
344. As a student, I want to be able to upload my paper to the plagiarism checker so that I can ensure that my work is original and properly cited.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should have a file upload feature accessible from the homepage.
	The student should be able to upload their paper in a supported file format, such as .docx or .pdf.
	The website should scan the paper for plagiarism and provide a report on the originality of the content.
	The student should be able to view a detailed report that highlights any instances of plagiarism or improper citations.
	The website should provide suggestions for correcting plagiarism and citing sources properly.

345. As an instructor, I want to be able to check my students' papers for plagiarism so that I can ensure academic integrity and provide feedback on their work.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide an instructor dashboard where the instructor can view their classes and assignments.
	The instructor should be able to upload a student's paper to the plagiarism checker from the assignment page.
	The website should scan the paper for plagiarism and provide a report on the originality of the content.
	The instructor should be able to view a detailed report that highlights any instances of plagiarism or improper citations.
	The website should provide suggestions for correcting plagiarism and citing sources properly.

346. As an administrator, I want to be able to manage user accounts and access reports on plagiarism detection so that I can monitor usage and compliance with academic policies.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide an administrator dashboard where the administrator can view user accounts and reports.
	The administrator should be able to create, edit, and delete user accounts for students, instructors, and other staff.
	The website should provide usage reports on the number of papers scanned, instances of plagiarism detected, and other relevant metrics.
	The administrator should be able to view detailed reports on plagiarism detection, including trends over time and common sources of plagiarism.
	The website should provide a feature for the administrator to set permissions and access levels for different user roles.

347. As a student, I want to be able to view my plagiarism report and make corrections to my paper so that I can improve my writing and avoid academic dishonesty.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should display the plagiarism report for the student's paper, including highlighted instances of plagiarism.
	The student should be able to view suggestions for correcting plagiarism and citing sources properly.
	The website should provide a feature for the student to make corrections to their paper directly within the platform.
	The student should be able to save their changes and download an updated version of their paper.
	The website should provide resources and tutorials on how to avoid plagiarism and cite sources correctly.

348. As an instructor, I want to be able to view my students' plagiarism reports and provide feedback on their work so that I can support their academic development.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should display the plagiarism reports for each student's paper, including highlighted instances of plagiarism.
	The instructor should be able to view suggestions for correcting plagiarism and citing sources properly.
	The website should provide a feature for the instructor to leave comments and feedback on the student's paper.
	The instructor should be able to grade the paper and provide an overall assessment of the originality and quality of the work.
	The website should provide resources and tutorials on how to address plagiarism and promote academic integrity.

349. As an administrator, I want to be able to generate usage reports and monitor system performance so that I can ensure the reliability and effectiveness of the plagiarism checker.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide usage reports on the number of papers scanned, instances of plagiarism detected, and other relevant metrics.
	The administrator should be able to filter and export usage data for specific time periods and user roles.
	The website should display system performance metrics, such as response time, uptime, and error rates.
	The administrator should be able to view logs and error reports to troubleshoot issues and optimize system performance.
	The website should provide a feature for the administrator to set up alerts for system maintenance and updates.

350. As a student, I want to be able to access resources and tutorials on academic integrity and citation practices so that I can improve my writing skills and avoid plagiarism.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide a resources section with articles, videos, and tutorials on academic integrity and citation practices.
	The student should be able to access guides on how to avoid plagiarism, cite sources properly, and use citation styles such as APA, MLA, and Chicago.
	The website should provide examples of proper citation formats and common mistakes to avoid.
	The student should be able to take quizzes and self-assessments on plagiarism and citation practices.
	The website should provide links to additional resources and tools for improving writing skills and academic research.
 Given the above user stories, give me a use case diagram.
output:
@startuml
left to right direction

actor Student
actor Instructor
actor Administrator

rectangle TurnitinPlagiarismChecker {
    usecase "Upload Paper" as UC1
    usecase "Check Papers for Plagiarism" as UC2
    usecase "Manage User Accounts" as UC3
    usecase "View Plagiarism Report" as UC4
    usecase "Provide Feedback" as UC5
    usecase "Generate Usage Reports" as UC6
    usecase "Access Resources and Tutorials" as UC7
    usecase "Manage Access Reports" as UC8
    
}

Student --> UC1
Student --> UC4
Student --> UC7
Instructor --> UC2
Instructor --> UC5
Instructor --> UC7
Administrator --> UC3
Administrator --> UC8
Administrator --> UC6
Administrator --> UC7
@enduml

input:
Given the following user stories, give me a use case diagram. 
User stories for Online shopping platform
360. As a customer, I want to be able to browse products by category and search for specific items so that I can find and purchase the items I need.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should have a search bar and category filters accessible from the homepage.
	The customer should be able to enter keywords or browse categories to find products.
	The website should display a list of products with images, descriptions, and prices.
	The customer should be able to filter search results by price, brand, size, color, and other relevant criteria.
	The website should provide recommendations and related products based on the customer's search history.

361. As a customer, I want to be able to view product details, images, and reviews so that I can make an informed decision about my purchase.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide detailed information about each product, including specifications, features, and dimensions.
	The customer should be able to view high-quality images of the product from different angles.
	The website should display reviews and ratings from other customers who have purchased the product.
	The customer should be able to read written reviews and see photos of the product in use.
	The website should provide information on availability, shipping options, and return policies.

362. As a customer, I want to be able to add products to my shopping cart, view my cart, and proceed to checkout so that I can complete my purchase.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should have an add to cart button on each product page.
	The customer should be able to add products to their cart and view the total cost of their items.
	The website should display a summary of the customer's cart, including product details, quantities, and prices.
	The customer should be able to update quantities, remove items, and apply promo codes or discounts.
	The website should provide a secure checkout process with options for guest checkout or account creation.

363. As a customer, I want to be able to create an account, save my payment information, and track my order history so that I can easily shop and manage my purchases.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide a registration form for customers to create an account.
	The customer should be able to save their shipping address, payment information, and order preferences.
	The website should display an account dashboard where the customer can view their order history, tracking information, and account settings.
	The customer should be able to track the status of their orders, view estimated delivery dates, and contact customer support.
	The website should provide options for the customer to subscribe to newsletters, promotions, and loyalty programs.

364. As a customer, I want to be able to track my order status, receive shipping updates, and contact customer support so that I can stay informed and resolve any issues with my purchase.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide an order tracking feature accessible from the customer's account dashboard.
	The customer should be able to enter their order number or email address to track the status of their shipment.
	The website should send email notifications with shipping updates, estimated delivery dates, and tracking numbers.
	The customer should be able to contact customer support through live chat, email, or phone for assistance with their order.
	The website should provide a help center with FAQs, return policies, and contact information for customer service.

365. As a customer, I want to be able to leave product reviews, ratings, and feedback so that I can share my experience with other shoppers and help improve the shopping experience.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide a review and rating feature on each product page.
	The customer should be able to leave a star rating and written review of the product.
	The website should display the average star rating and number of reviews for each product.
	The customer should be able to filter reviews by star rating, date, or keyword.
	The website should provide an option for the customer to leave feedback on their overall shopping experience.

366. As a customer, I want to be able to receive personalized recommendations, promotions, and discounts based on my browsing and purchase history so that I can discover new products and save money.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide personalized recommendations on the homepage and product pages.
	The customer should see recommended products based on their browsing history, purchase behavior, and preferences.
	The website should send email notifications with promotions, discounts, and new arrivals tailored to the customer's interests.
	The customer should be able to opt in or out of personalized recommendations and marketing communications.
	The website should provide a loyalty program with rewards, points, and exclusive offers for repeat customers.

367. As a customer, I want to be able to access customer support, return or exchange products, and request refunds so that I can resolve any issues with my purchase and receive assistance when needed.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide a help center with FAQs, return policies, and contact information for customer support.
	The customer should be able to contact customer support through live chat, email, or phone for assistance with their order.
	The website should display information on return and exchange policies, including timeframes, conditions, and shipping instructions.
	The customer should be able to request a return or exchange through their account dashboard and receive a return label.
	The website should provide a refund process with options for store credit, exchange, or original payment method.
output:
@startuml
left to right direction

actor Customer

rectangle OnlineShoppingPlatform {
    usecase "Browse and Search Products" as UC1
    usecase "View Product Information" as UC2
    usecase "Add Products to Cart" as UC3
    usecase "Checkout" as UC3A
    usecase "Manage Account" as UC4
    usecase "Track Orders and Access Support" as UC5
    usecase "Leave Reviews and Ratings" as UC6
    usecase "Receive Personalized Recommendations" as UC7
    usecase "Request Refunds and Return Products" as UC8
}

UC3 ..> UC3A : <<extend>>

Customer --> UC1
Customer --> UC2
Customer --> UC3
Customer --> UC3A
Customer --> UC4
Customer --> UC5
Customer --> UC6

input:
User stories for Supply chain management
368. As a manufacturer, I want to be able to track raw materials, inventory levels, and production schedules so that I can optimize production and meet customer demand.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The system should provide a dashboard for manufacturers to view real-time data on raw material availability, inventory levels, and production status.
	The manufacturer should be able to track the location, quantity, and expiration dates of raw materials in the supply chain.
	The system should display production schedules, work orders, and lead times for each product line.
	The manufacturer should be able to set alerts and notifications for low inventory levels, delays, or quality issues.
	The system should provide analytics and reports on production efficiency, waste reduction, and cost savings.

369. As a distributor, I want to be able to manage orders, shipments, and delivery schedules so that I can fulfill customer orders on time and maintain inventory accuracy.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The system should provide a dashboard for distributors to view incoming orders, shipment status, and delivery schedules.
	The distributor should be able to process orders, allocate inventory, and generate packing lists for shipments.
	The system should track the location, quantity, and condition of products in transit and at warehouses.
	The distributor should be able to schedule deliveries, assign routes, and provide tracking information to customers.
	The system should provide alerts and notifications for delayed shipments, out-of-stock items, and order changes.

370. As a retailer, I want to be able to manage inventory, sales, and customer orders so that I can optimize stock levels, reduce costs, and improve customer satisfaction.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The system should provide a dashboard for retailers to view real-time data on inventory levels, sales performance, and customer orders.
	The retailer should be able to track product availability, stock levels, and reorder points for each store location.
	The system should display sales reports, revenue forecasts, and product trends to help with inventory planning.
	The retailer should be able to process customer orders, allocate stock, and provide order status updates.
	The system should provide alerts and notifications for low stock levels, overstocked items, and slow-moving inventory.

371. As a logistics provider, I want to be able to manage transportation, warehousing, and distribution operations so that I can optimize routes, reduce costs, and improve delivery efficiency.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The system should provide a dashboard for logistics providers to view real-time data on transportation routes, warehouse capacity, and delivery schedules.
	The provider should be able to track the location, status, and condition of shipments in transit and at warehouses.
	The system should display route optimization tools, traffic updates, and weather alerts to help with delivery planning.
	The provider should be able to assign drivers, vehicles, and routes based on delivery priorities and customer requirements.
	The system should provide alerts and notifications for delays, route changes, and delivery exceptions.

372. As a customer, I want to be able to track my orders, receive delivery updates, and contact customer support so that I can stay informed and resolve any issues with my purchase.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The system should provide an order tracking feature accessible from the customer's account dashboard.
	The customer should be able to enter their order number or email address to track the status of their shipment.
	The system should send email notifications with shipping updates, estimated delivery dates, and tracking numbers.
	The customer should be able to contact customer support through live chat, email, or phone for assistance with their order.
	The system should provide a help center with FAQs, return policies, and contact information for customer service.

373. As a supplier, I want to be able to manage orders, shipments, and inventory levels so that I can fulfill customer orders on time and maintain supply chain efficiency.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The system should provide a dashboard for suppliers to view incoming orders, shipment status, and inventory levels.
	The supplier should be able to process orders, allocate inventory, and generate packing lists for shipments.
	The system should track the location, quantity, and condition of products in transit and at warehouses.
	The supplier should be able to schedule deliveries, assign carriers, and provide tracking information to customers.
	The system should provide alerts and notifications for delayed shipments, out-of-stock items, and order changes.

374. As a warehouse manager, I want to be able to track inventory, manage storage space, and optimize picking and packing processes so that I can improve warehouse efficiency and reduce costs.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The system should provide a dashboard for warehouse managers to view real-time data on inventory levels, storage capacity, and order fulfillment rates.
	The manager should be able to track the location, quantity, and condition of products in the warehouse.
	The system should display storage bin locations, picking routes, and packing instructions for each order.
	The manager should be able to assign tasks, monitor productivity, and optimize warehouse layout for efficiency.
	The system should provide alerts and notifications for low stock levels, overstocked items, and order changes.
 Given the following user stories, create a use case diagram for the supply chain management system.

input:
User stories for Oladoc doctor management system
375. As a patient, I want to be able to search for doctors by specialty, location, and availability so that I can find a healthcare provider that meets my needs.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should have a search bar accessible from the homepage.
	The patient should be able to enter a specialty, location, and preferred appointment time to search for doctors.
	The website should display a list of doctors in the selected area, including their profiles and availability.
	The patient should be able to filter search results by doctor rating, experience, and other relevant criteria.
	The website should provide information on each doctor's qualifications, certifications, and areas of expertise.

376. As a patient, I want to be able to view doctor profiles, patient reviews, and appointment availability so that I can make an informed decision about my healthcare provider.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide detailed profiles for each doctor, including their education, experience, and specialties.
	The patient should be able to view photos of the doctor, as well as reviews and ratings from other patients.
	The website should display the doctor's availability, appointment hours, and contact information.
	The patient should be able to read written reviews and see ratings for the doctor's bedside manner, wait time, and office environment.
	The website should provide information on the doctor's clinic location, hours of operation, and accepted insurance plans.

377. As a patient, I want to be able to book an appointment online, view my appointment history, and receive reminders so that I can manage my healthcare appointments efficiently.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should have a booking form accessible from each doctor's profile.
	The patient should be able to select an appointment time, enter their symptoms, and confirm the booking.
	The website should display the patient's appointment history, including past and upcoming appointments.
	The patient should receive email or SMS reminders before their appointment with details on time, location, and doctor's name.
	The website should provide a feature for the patient to reschedule or cancel appointments within a specified timeframe.

378. As a patient, I want to be able to view my medical records, test results, and prescriptions online so that I can track my health history and share information with other healthcare providers.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide a patient portal where the patient can log in and view their medical records.
	The patient should be able to access test results, lab reports, and imaging studies from past appointments.
	The website should display a list of current medications, dosages, and prescription refills.
	The patient should be able to download or print their medical records for personal use or to share with other doctors.
	The website should provide a secure messaging feature for patients to communicate with their healthcare providers.

379. As a doctor, I want to be able to manage my schedule, view patient appointments, and communicate with patients online so that I can provide quality care and improve patient outcomes.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide a doctor dashboard where the doctor can log in and view their schedule.
	The doctor should be able to see a list of upcoming appointments, patient details, and appointment notes.
	The website should display patient medical records, test results, and prescription history for each appointment.
	The doctor should be able to send messages to patients with instructions, follow-up care, or test results.
	The website should provide a feature for the doctor to update patient records, add notes, and order tests or prescriptions.

380. As a clinic administrator, I want to be able to manage doctor profiles, patient appointments, and clinic operations so that I can streamline workflow, improve efficiency, and enhance patient satisfaction.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide an administrator dashboard where the clinic administrator can log in and view clinic data.
	The administrator should be able to add, edit, or delete doctor profiles, including contact information, specialties, and availability.
	The website should display a calendar feature for the administrator to view and manage patient appointments.
	The administrator should be able to assign rooms, equipment, and support staff for each appointment.
	The website should provide analytics and reports on clinic performance, patient satisfaction, and appointment scheduling.

381. As a healthcare provider, I want to be able to access patient records, update treatment plans, and communicate with other providers so that I can coordinate care, monitor progress, and ensure continuity of care.
Acceptance Criteria:
	The website should provide a secure portal for healthcare providers to log in and access patient records.
	The provider should be able to view medical history, test results, and treatment plans for each patient.
	The website should display a list of current medications, allergies, and chronic conditions for each patient.
	The provider should be able to update treatment plans, order tests, and prescribe medications online.
	The website should provide a messaging feature for providers to communicate with other healthcare professionals, share information, and coordinate care.

input:
1. As a prospective student, I want to create an account, so that I can start my application process.
Acceptance Criteria:
 - The system should allow the student to create an account using their email and password.
 - The student should receive a confirmation email after successful registration.
 - The student should be able to log in using their credentials.

2. As a prospective student, I want to fill out my application form online, so that I can apply to the university.
Acceptance Criteria:
 - The system should provide an application form with sections like personal details, academic background, and program selection.
 - The student should be able to save their progress while completing the form.

3. As a prospective student, I want to upload my academic documents, so that I can complete my application.
Acceptance Criteria:
 - The system should allow the student to upload multiple document formats (PDF, DOC, JPG, etc.).
 - The system should validate the file size and format before uploading.
 - The student should be able to view and replace uploaded documents.

4. As an admissions officer, I want to review applications, so that I can evaluate prospective students.
Acceptance Criteria:
 - The system should provide a list of submitted applications for review.
 - The admissions officer should be able to view each applicant's details, documents, and application status.
 - The system should allow the admissions officer to update the status of the application (e.g., pending, accepted, rejected).

5. As a prospective student, I want to track the status of my application, so that I know the progress of my admission.
Acceptance Criteria:
 - The system should display the current status of the student's application (e.g., in review, accepted, rejected).
 - The system should send notifications via email or SMS when the application status changes.

6. As an administrator, I want to manage program availability, so that I can ensure students apply to the correct programs.
Acceptance Criteria:
 - The system should allow the administrator to add, edit, or remove academic programs and their details (e.g., name, description, deadlines).
 - The system should reflect updated program information in real-time on the student application form.

7. As an administrator, I want to generate reports on application data, so that I can analyze admission trends.
Acceptance Criteria:
 - The system should allow the administrator to generate reports based on various criteria (e.g., number of applications, acceptance rate).
 - The reports should be exportable in multiple formats (e.g., CSV, PDF).

8. As a prospective student, I want to pay my application fee online, so that I can complete my application submission.
Acceptance Criteria:
 - The system should provide secure online payment options (e.g., credit card, PayPal).
 - The student should receive a payment confirmation after successful payment.
 - The system should allow the student to view their payment history.
 I want a use case diagram for this.
output:

Acceptance Criteria:

 - The app should send notifications on the scheduled date and time.

Acceptance Criteria:

 - The app should display upcoming vaccines based on standard pet care schedules.

4. As a pet owner, I want to find nearby pet-friendly parks and clinics, so that I can take my pet for outings or medical care.
Acceptance Criteria:

1. As a pet seeker, I want to search for pets by breed, age, and location, so that I can find a pet that matches my preferences.
Acceptance Criteria:
 - The app should allow the user to filter search results by breed, age, size, and location.
 - The app should display a list of available pets with profiles that include pictures, descriptions, and availability.

2. As a pet owner, I want to list my pet for adoption or sale, so that I can find a new home for my pet.
Acceptance Criteria:
 - The app should allow the owner to create a pet listing with details like breed, age, health status, and price (if selling).
 - The owner should be able to upload photos of the pet and provide a description.
 - The app should display the listing to potential adopters or buyers in relevant searches.

3. As a pet seeker, I want to be able to save pets Im interested in, so that I can come back to view them later.
Acceptance Criteria:
 - The app should provide a Save or Favorite button on each pet profile.
 - The user should be able to view their list of saved pets in a dedicated section of the app.

4. As a pet owner, I want to manage my listings, so that I can update, delete, or mark them as sold or adopted.
Acceptance Criteria:
 - The app should allow the owner to view their active listings.
 - The owner should be able to edit the pets information, update the status, or remove the listing.

5. As a pet seeker, I want to contact the pet owner, so that I can ask questions and arrange a meeting or purchase.
Acceptance Criteria:
 - The app should provide a secure messaging feature to allow the pet seeker and owner to communicate.
 - The user should receive notifications when they receive a new message.

6. As a pet seeker, I want to be able to filter for pets available for adoption or sale, so that I can quickly find what I am looking for.
Acceptance Criteria:
 - The app should allow the user to filter pets by whether they are for adoption or sale.
 - The filtered list should display only relevant pets based on the selected option.

7. As a pet owner, I want to specify the adoption or sale fee, so that potential adopters or buyers can see the cost upfront.
Acceptance Criteria:
 - The app should provide an option for the owner to set an adoption fee or sale price when creating a listing.
 - The fee or price should be clearly displayed on the pet profile.

8. As a pet seeker, I want to read reviews about the pet owners, so that I can trust who Im dealing with.
Acceptance Criteria:
 - The app should allow users to leave reviews and ratings for pet owners after a transaction or adoption is completed.
 - The reviews should be visible on the pet owner's profile for others to see.

9. As a pet owner, I want to verify the identity of potential adopters or buyers, so that I can ensure my pet goes to a responsible home.
Acceptance Criteria:
 - The app should allow the pet owner to request identity verification (e.g., ID upload) from potential adopters or buyers.
 - The app should provide a feature for the owner to approve or decline requests based on the verification.

10. As a pet seeker, I want to receive notifications when new pets matching my criteria are listed, so that I can stay updated.
Acceptance Criteria:
 - The app should allow the user to set up alerts based on breed, age, or location preferences.
 - The app should send push notifications or emails when new pets matching the criteria are available.

11. As a pet owner, I want to track the number of views or inquiries on my pet listing, so that I know how much interest there is.
Acceptance Criteria:
 - The app should display statistics for each listing, such as the number of views and messages received.
 - The owner should be able to access these stats from their dashboard.

12. As a pet trader, I want to manage payments through the app, so that I can securely sell pets and handle transactions.
Acceptance Criteria:
 - The app should provide integrated payment options (e.g., credit card, PayPal) for handling pet sale transactions.
 - The app should ensure secure payment processing and display payment status to both parties.

13. As a pet seeker, I want to read details about each pets health and vaccination history, so that I can make an informed decision.
Acceptance Criteria:
 - The app should provide a section on each pets profile to include health and vaccination records.
 - The owner should be able to upload or provide details about the pets health status.

14. As a pet owner, I want to schedule meetings with potential adopters or buyers through the app, so that I can manage viewing appointments.
Acceptance Criteria:
 - The app should provide a calendar or appointment scheduling feature for pet owners and seekers to arrange meetings.
 - The app should send reminders about upcoming appointments to both parties. Design a use case diagram for this app.
